title: Bug 49195: Error message printed when using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service
description:
When configuring <Server port="1" in server.xml3 and using it as the shutdown port for a Windows service, Tomcat prints the following error message in the catalina.20100427.log: 

27.04.2010 17:49:13 org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina stopServerSEVERE: No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.

Despite the error message, Tomcat is actually stopped successfully. After printing the error message, Catalina stopServer() method is called, which leads to the shutdown of Tomcat using System.exit(1). This behavior occurs even if the service launcher is used to stop Tomcat, where Catalina server instance is not null.
OB: When using 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service, Tomcat prints the error message 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.' in catalina.20100427.log
EB: When using 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service, Tomcat should not print any error message in catalina.20100427.log
SR:
1. Configure <Server port="1" in server.xml
2. Deploy Tomcat as a Windows service
3. Start the Tomcat service
4. Check the catalina.20100427.log for any error messages related to the shutdown port
